data.name: MSG_WritingSummary
data.value: Writing processing summary to {0}

data.name: ERR_NoProjectInfoFilesFound
data.value: The SonarScanner for MSBuild integration failed: SonarQube was unable to collect the required information about your projects. Possible causes: 1. The project has not been built - the project must be built in between the begin and end steps. 2. An unsupported version of MSBuild has been used to build the project. Supported versions: MSBuild 16 and higher. 3. The begin, build and end steps have not all been launched from the same folder. 4. None of the analyzed projects have a valid ProjectGuid and you have not used a solution (.sln).

data.name: ERR_NoValidProjectInfoFiles
data.value: No analysable projects were found. SonarQube analysis will not be performed. Check the build summary report for details.

data.name: ERR_SonarScannerExecutionFailed
data.value: The SonarScanner did not complete successfully

data.name: WARN_DisableScanAllAnalysisWhenProvidingParameters
data.value: The support for multi-language analysis may not function correctly if {0} is set. If this is the case, please explicitly set "sonar.scanner.scanAll=false" to disable the multi-language analysis.

data.name: MSG_ProjectBaseDirChange
data.value: Starting with Scanner for .NET v8 the way the `sonar.projectBaseDir` property is automatically detected has changed and this has an impact on the files that are analyzed and other properties that are resolved relative to it like `sonar.exclusions` and `sonar.test.exclusions`. If you would like to customize the behavior, please set the `sonar.projectBaseDir` property to point to a directory that contains all the source code you want to analyze. The path may be relative (to the directory from which the analysis was started) or absolute.
